snippet: Matthew Quick’s “The Good Luck of Right Now” revolves around a dysfunctional middle-aged man who tries to figure out his life through a series of whimsical letters to the actor Richard Gere.
abstract: Janet Maslin reviews book The Good Luck of Right Now by Matthew Quick.
lead_paragraph: Matthew Quick’s “The Good Luck of Right Now” revolves around a dysfunctional middle-aged man who tries to figure out his life through a series of whimsical letters to the actor Richard Gere.

headline.seo: ‘The Good Luck of Right Now’ Is a Story of Cute Misfits
headline.main: Movie Star Points Way to Sanity, Maybe
headline.print_headline: Movie Star Points Way to Sanity, Maybe
